title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.25 Part 2 | 03-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Mirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: This child will be like Bali Maharaj in patience. A staunch devotee of Lord Krishna like Prahlad Maharaj, a performer of many Ashwamedha sacrifices and a follower of the old and experienced men.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse to be discussed, focusing on the comparison of a child to Prahlad Maharaj as a staunch devotee of Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada says a perfect devotee of Lord Krishna, his father, Prahlad's father, Hiranyakashyapu, chastised him severely when he was only five years old, for his becoming an unalloyed devotee of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker begins narrating the history of Prahlad Maharaj, highlighting his devotion to Lord Krishna and the opposition he faced from his father, Hiranyakashipu.

segments.key_quote: Prahlad taught the teachers that the mentality of ownership is false and that he was therefore trying to become an unalloyed devotee of the Lord Vishnu.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Prahlad's disinterest in material education and his continued devotion to Krishna, even teaching his teachers about the falsity of ownership.

segments.key_quote: Since Prahlad was so treacherous that he had become a devotee of Vishnu, who had killed his uncle Hiranyakashipu, Hiranyakashipu asked his assistants to kill him.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the escalating conflict between Prahlad and Hiranyakashipu, including Hiranyakashipu's attempts to kill Prahlad due to his devotion to Vishnu.

segments.key_quote: Nobody can do anything to the boy because he is protected by the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes Prahlad's divine protection despite Hiranyakashipu's relentless attempts to harm him, highlighting Hiranyakashipu's lack of understanding.

segments.key_quote: The more Prahlad glorified Vishnu, the more angry and agitated became Hiranyakashipu.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Prahlad's preaching to his classmates, their growing devotion to Vishnu, and Hiranyakashipu's increasing anger and agitation.

segments.key_quote: Suddenly there issued a tumultuous sound and the Supreme Lord in his wonderful form of Narasimha, half man, half lion, came out of the pillar.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the appearance of Lord Narasimha from the pillar and the subsequent killing of Hiranyakashipu, bringing relief to the universe.

segments.key_quote: So, this great Prahlad Maharaj, staunch devotee of the Supreme Lord, was compared by the brahmanas to actually convince Yudhishthira that Pariksit, the child, will be as staunch a devotee as this Prahlad Maharaj.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating the comparison of Pariksit to Prahlad Maharaj, emphasizing the latter's staunch devotion and the purpose of the brahmanas' comparison.
